title: Asian shares ease off three-week highs as virus fears return
text: Asian shares stepped back from three-week highs on Monday as investors weighed the near-term hit on global growth from a fast-spreading coronavirus outbreak in China, although expectations of further policy stimulus helped stem losses.

title: Oil prices slip ahead of data pointers on impact of coronavirus on demand
text: Oil prices edged lower on Monday as investors brace for economic data in Asia due this week that should give a reading on how China's coronavirus epidemic has affected oil demand.

title: Companies paid record $1.43tn in dividends in 2019
text: Rise driven by strong market performances in North America and emerging economies

title: The Odds of a Recession Within the Next 12 Months
text: The outbreak of the coronavirus proved to be a reality check for investors who were uber-bullish about the prospects of the American economy and capital markets.

title: The Case for Information Technology Dividend Growers
text: One of the common misconceptions in finance is that companies from the Information Technology (Tech) sector do not pay dividends. While this may have been the trend a long time ago, this has certainly not been the trend over the past 10 years.

title: Brent Versus WTI Crude
text: Crude oil is the most abundant and most traded commodity in the world, and it is one of the first places market participants look when seeking commodity exposure.

title: ETF Model Portfolios: Why Now?

title: Successful Investing Amidst Change And Uncertainty

title: What Would You Put In A 100-Year Portfolio?
